item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device Serial Number
item.description: System serial number for this device

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Download - $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MTU of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Upload - $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MacAddress of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface's media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Download - $1
item_prototype.description: "The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can ccur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime."

item_prototype.name: Upload - $1
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to `n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nomina bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: MTU of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Name of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The textual name of the interface

item_prototype.name: Status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: MacAddress of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface's media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MTU of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: Status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Upload - $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: MacAddress of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The interface's address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface's media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item_prototype.name: Speed of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device Maximum number of connection cache
item.description: Maximum number of connection cache entries allowed through the firewall

item.name: Device Current active connection cache
item.description: Number of active connection cache entries through the firewall

item.name: Device CPU Utilization
item.description: Instantaneous CPU Utilization in percent

item.name: Device RAM Utilization
item.description: Instantaneous RAM Utilization in percent

item.name: Device Model
item.description: System model name and number

item.name: Device Serial Number
item.description: System serial number for this device

item.name: Device Firmware version
item.description: Current system firmware version

item.name: Device ROM version
item.description: Current system ROM version

item.name: Device Asset number
item.description: Asset Number device

template.name: Template - Backup Zabbix

item.description: Backup - Zabbix Frontend - Nome do Ultimo

item.description: Backup - Zabbix Frontend - Status Dirio 00:10

item.description: Backup - Zabbix Frontend - Erros.

item.name: MySQL status
item.description:
It requires user parameter mysql.ping, which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.
0 - MySQL server is down 1 - MySQL server is up

item.name: Tamanho dos dados da tabela History da base de dados do Zabbix
Tamanho dos indices da tabela History da base de dados do Zabbix
Tamanho da tabela History da base de dados do Zabbix
Tamanho da base de dados do Zabbix
MySQL bytes received per second
item.description:
The number of bytes received from all clients.
It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL bytes sent per second
item.description:
The number of bytes sent to all clients.
It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL begin operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL commit operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL delete operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL insert operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL rollback operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL select operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL update operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL queries per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL slow queries
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL uptime
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL version
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.version, which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: CPU Time (idle)
item.description: Tempo 'livre' da CPU.

item.name: CPU Time (system)
item.description: Tempo que a CPU leva executando processos do Kernel.

item.name: CPU Time (total)
item.description: Tempo em que a CPU passa executando processos do usurio.

item.name: CPU Time (user)
item.description: Tempo em que a CPU passa executando processos do usurio.

item.name: File read bytes per second
item.description: Full counter name: \System\File Read Bytes/sec

item.name: File write bytes per second
item.description: Full counter name: \System\File Write Bytes/sec

item.name: Number of threads
item.description: Full counter name: \System\Threads

item.name: Average disk read queue length
item.description: Full counter name: \PhysicalDisk(_Total)\Avg. Disk Read Queue Length

item.name: Average disk write queue length
item.description: Full counter name: \PhysicalDisk(_Total)\Avg. Disk Write Queue Length

item.name: Processor load (1 min average)
item.description: Mdia da carga de CPU pela quantidade de ncleos (ltimo minuto).

item.name: Processor load (5 min average)
item.description: Mdia da carga de CPU pela quantidade de ncleos (ltimos cinco minutos).

item.name: Processor load (15 min average)
item.description: Mdia da carga de CPU pela quantidade de ncleos (ltimos quinze minutos).

item.name: Processor load (All)
item.description: Mdia da carga de CPU pela quantidade de ncleos (ltimo minuto).

item.name: CPU - Number of cores (total)
item.description: Quantidade total de ncleos de CPU disponveis, juntando sockets + threads.

item.name: Hostname
item.description: Nome do host.

item.name: Host local time
item.description: Horrio verificado localmente no host monitorado.

item.name: Memria swap livre
item.description: Quantidade de memria swap Livre.

item.name: Memria swap utilizada
item.description: Quantidade de memria Swap em utilizao.

item.name: System information
item.description: Retorno do comando 'uname -a'.

item.name: Memria RAM disponvel
item.description: Quantidade de memria disponvel. Soma de inactive + cached + free. inactive - memria que marcada como no utilizada. cached - cache para vrias coisas. free - memria que est prontamente disponvel para qualquer entidade que a requisite.

item.name: Memria RAM em cache
item.description: Memria que est em estado de cache.

item.name: Memria RAM livre
item.description: free - memria que est prontamente disponvel para qualquer entidade que a requisite.

item.name: Memria RAM total
item.description: Quantidade total de memria RAM instalada no Computador.

item.name: Memria RAM em uso
item.description: Memria atualmente em uso ou usada muito recentemente.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Descoberta de interfaces de rede, como definido na expresso regular global "Network interfaces for discovery".

item_prototype.name: Incoming network traffic on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: Trfego de entrada em bps (bits por segundo), para uma interface de rede.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing network traffic on {#IFNAME}
item_prototype.description: Trfego de sada (em bps), para uma interface de rede.

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Descoberta de sistemas de arquivos (discos/parties), de diferentes tipos, como definido na Expresso Regular "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 10% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU $1 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Host name
item.description: System host name.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Memory RAM Available
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Memory RAM Cache
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Memory RAM Free
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Memory RAM Used
item.description: Used now memory

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: Espcie de ping, mas utilizando a linguagem do agente zabbix, para determinar o status do host monitorado. Retorno=1.

item.name: Processes - Zabbix_agentd instances (running)
item.description: Quantidade de processos Zabbix_agentd rodando.

item.name: Memory Consumption by Zabbix_agentd
item.description: Quantidade de memria utilizada pelo processo Zabbix_agentd.

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=3) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=8)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature lower critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=3) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=8)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature lower critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=8) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=13)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature lower non-critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=8) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}<=13)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature lower non-critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=47) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=42)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature upper critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=47) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=42)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature upper critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=42) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=37)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature upper non-critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=42) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.Ambient_Temp.last(0)}>=37)
trigger.name: Ambient Temp temperature upper non-critical on {HOSTNAME}
Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Consumo de CPU superior a 90% por 5 minutos.
Consumo de memria superior a 90% por 5 minutos
CPU is above 80% in {HOST.NAME} in the last 2 min
Disk I/O is overloaded on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.fan.1.rpm.last(0)}<=1075) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI - iLO 4 HP ProLiant:ipmi.sensor.fan.1.rpm.last(0)}<=1195)
trigger.name: FAN 1 RPM lower critical on {HOSTNAME}

trigger.expression: ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=0 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.fan.1.rpm.last(0)}<=1075) or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template IPMI Dell PowerEdge T410:ipmi.sensor.fan.1.rpm.last(0)}<=1195)
trigger.name: FAN 1 RPM lower critical on {HOSTNAME}
Host name of zabbix_agentd was changed on {HOST.NAME}
Host name of zabbix_agentd was changed on {HOST.NAME}
Lack of available memory on server {HOST.NAME}
Lack of free swap space on {HOST.NAME}
